name: pacvar-structural-variants
title: Long-Read Structural Variant Detection (PacBio)
description: Detect structural variants (SVs) from PacBio long-read sequencing. Identifies insertions, deletions, inversions, duplications, and translocations with superior accuracy compared to short reads. Samplesheet format: `sample,bam,bai`
content:
Structural Variant Detection with PacBio

Long-read PacBio sequencing excels at detecting structural variants (SVs) that are difficult or impossible to identify with short reads.

Why Long Reads for SVs?

  • Read Length: 10-30 kb reads span entire SVs
  • Accuracy: HiFi reads ~99.9% accuracy
  • Complex Regions: Resolve repeats, segmental duplications
  • Phasing: Haplotype-resolved SV calling
  • Discovery: Find novel SVs missed by short reads

SV Types Detected

  • Deletions: 50bp to several Mb
  • Insertions: Including mobile elements (Alu, LINE)
  • Inversions: Large chromosomal rearrangements
  • Duplications: Tandem and interspersed
  • Translocations: Inter-chromosomal events
  • Complex SVs: Combinations of multiple events

Applications

  • Cancer Genomics: Oncogenic fusions, chromothripsis
  • Rare Disease: Diagnostic SVs
  • Population Genetics: SV diversity
  • Evolutionary Studies: Species-specific SVs

Pipeline Features

  • SV Calling: pbsv or Sniffles2
  • Phasing: HapCut2 haplotype-resolved variants
  • Quality Filtering: Remove false positives
  • Annotation: Gene overlap, functional impact

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet: sample, bam, pbi (PacBio HiFi BAM files)

Key Outputs

  • SV VCF: Called structural variants
  • Phased SVs: Haplotype assignments
  • QC Metrics: Read length, coverage, SV counts

Perfect for: Cancer SVs • Rare disease diagnosis • Complex genome regions • Population genomics
